string.text: People are talking about some "dark stalker" from an unknown faction. Apparently, he's preaching about the Zone on and on. Have you heard of him?
Any new orders, General?

Initiative, I like that. The 100 Rads Bar is known for its... colourful crowds. But it seems we have a new patron, and he is causing trouble. No violence so far, but he has been rather aggressively promoting the Zone's "greatness". He thinks that by staying away from our main base, we'll ignore him. He is wrong. Find him and feign interest in his drivel. Extract any useful information you can. Once you feel you have enough, you have my permission to terminate him.
Understood. We cannot tolerate pro-Zone fanatics on our turf.
I apologise General. I'm going to need time to prepare myself for the interrogation.
I am glad to hear it.
I completed my task, General.
I see you chose to spare the fanatic. Why is that?
I see that you have terminated the fanatic. Excellent. Now, your report.

He may be worth more to us captured. He claims to be some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He also says Sin are the Zone's true keepers. They're recruiting others to their cause in preparation for some massive campaign.

He was some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He claimed that his faction are the Zone's true keepers, and that they're recruiting others to their cause in preparation for some massive campaign.

You have done well, but this is a troubling development. There have been recent reports of conflict with an unknown stalker faction. Very hostile, they indiscriminately engage other stalker groups in a series of guerilla attacks. The last report came from the Red Forest. I want you to go see Forester, as he knows that place better than anyone. After that, assess the threat. Verify if those attackers are the "Sin" you've been told about. In the meantime, I will arrange "accommodations" for our unwelcome guest.

You have done well, but this is a troubling development. There have been recent reports of conflict with an unknown stalker faction. Very hostile, they indiscriminately engage other stalker groups in a series of guerilla attacks. The last report came from the Red Forest. I want you to go see Forester, as he knows that place better than anyone. After that, assess the threat. Verify if those attackers are the "Sin" you've been told about.
Sir, yes sir!
I have investigated the situation in the Red Forest, General.
Very well. What did you discover?

Sin were pursuing a comrade of Strelok, Stitch. I intercepted and destroyed their squad, then contacted the stalker. He confirmed that Sin have been preparing to launch a large scale invasion on the southern sectors of the Zone. Also, here's the PDA I took from the squad leader's body. You'll want to see this.

That is indeed grim news. Sometimes I wonder if the Zone is more stubborn than we are. When it's not one brainwashed cult, it's another. We ought to... hold on. Our western perimeter is under attack! Go, repel the enemy!
Roger that!
We've repelled the enemy, General.

Well done. Sin made a very bold move, one that will have severe consequences. Reports indicate that enemy forces are currently approaching the two psy-installations, most likely in order to reactivate them. That cannot be allowed. We must do our utmost to stop them from re-establishing such potent defences.
Which installation do you want me to defend, General?
Choose the one you wish to defend personally, I trust your experience in the matter. I'll muster a force to defend the other one myself. Make haste, we have little time to act.
I'll defend the Miracle Machine. It's a remote location so my help is more needed over there.
I'll defend the Brain Scorcher. We can't let the enemy regain such a formidable stronghold.
The enemy leader is dead, and their army decimated. Crisis averted, General.
Excellent work, excellent! I am very proud of you. You have become a paragon of Duty. While the Zone remains, it also remains contained. The outside world is safe.
Strelok and his companions were of great help, not to mention the efforts of our own forces.

That is right. Duty as a whole has fulfilled its promise to protect the innocent, with the aid of unusual allies. Speaking of allies, a former prisoner of war asked about you when he arrived. Contact him at your leisure.
That is right. Duty as a whole has fulfilled its promise to protect the innocent, with the aid of unusual allies.
Any further orders, General?
You are free to return to your regular duties. Dismissed.
Dushman, things seem a little tense at base. Anything going on?

Come to think of it, there's something strange I'd like you to deal with. A few days ago some sorta creepy guy decided to camp in this dump of a city. Wasn't hostile or anything, so we let him stay for the time being. Under a careful watch, just in case. Lately however he's been pestering the local mercs, on and on, about some disturbing spiritual crap. Talks about salvation and damnation, cleansing and what-not. People around here are beginning to think he's some Monolith bastard in disguise. Go have a proper talk with him. Find out what his deal is, and then deal with him.
Alright, I'll look into it. Guess I'm doing all the cleaning up when I'm done?
Doesn't sound too urgent. I'll talk to you again when I'm ready.
Yeah. Professional practice and all that. Now go.
I've talked with that creepy guy.
Just a little chit-chat, eh? You aren't getting a little soft, are you?
And you put him down, too. That's great, we were all fed up with that nutter. What did you find out?

I didn't want to invoke retaliation. He's some sort of agent. Supposedly belongs to a clandestine faction called Sin. He claims that they know more about the Zone than anyone else, and that they'll take over the world or something. Basically, he looks for recruits to join their cause.

He was some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He claimed that they know more about the Zone than anyone else, and they apparently plan to take over the world. Also, he was looking for recruits to join their cause.

Sin, you say. That actually rings a bell. I've had some reports regarding stalkers from a mysterious faction who engage in hit-and-run attacks on other stalkers. Alright. Might be worthwhile to beat some sense into our honoured guest. In the meantime, I want you to investigate a recent situation from the Red Forest. That's one of the places the mysterious stalkers, maybe from this "Sin" you've just learned about, are allegedly haunting. Start by talking with Forester, he'll know more about this.

Sin, you say. That actually rings a bell. I've had some reports regarding stalkers from a mysterious faction who engage in hit-and-run attacks on other stalkers. Alright. Let's say I'll take care of the mortal remains of our honoured guest. In the meantime, I want you to investigate a recent situation from the Red Forest. That's one of the places the mysterious stalkers, maybe from this "Sin" you've just learned about, are allegedly haunting. Start by talking with Forester, he'll know more about this.
No rest for the wicked. Okay, I'll go see what I can do.
I've been to the Red Forest, Dushman.
And you found something worth reporting, yes?

Quite. Sin were pursuing a comrade of Strelok whom I met during my previous mission. I intercepted and destroyed their squad, then contacted the stalker. He said that Sin have been preparing to launch a large scale invasion on the southern sectors of the Zone. He's a reliable person, and everything so far seems to support his claim. I've got the squad leader's PDA in case you want to take a look.

Shit. At least the Monolith tend to focus on defending their own territory. Now we've got a warmongering bunch of fanatics to deal with. I'm not big on faction wars, but we need the current status quo to function here. Alrighty, we... wait a second. Our men have sighted hostile forces nearby. Fuck! We're under attack! Go intercept the enemy, I'll prepare a defensive perimeter here!
I'm going!
I've kicked their asses.

Not bad. You've certainly earned your reputation. Still, we can't let those fuckers do as they please. Mercenary scouts have revealed this assault to be a diversion. The main Sin forces have slipped by us and are approaching the Brain Scorcher and Miracle Machine as I speak. They probably want those psychic defences back online. 'Course, we won't let that happen.
I can kill as many Sin fanatics as you want, but there's only one of me.
One of you is plenty. I'll assemble a task force to defend one of the installations. You can pick the one you want to protect yourself. Better hurry, we're working on a tight schedule here.
Miracle Machine. It's very close, so I might as well keep our neighbourhood secure.
Brain Scorcher. We can't let the enemy regain such a formidable stronghold.
I've kicked Sin's collective asses to kingdom come. They won't be taking over the world any time soon.
Now that's a professional one-man army here if I've ever seen one. Great job, merc.
Well, I did get some help from Strelok and his Merry Men.

True that, but you're the one who's getting paid in the end. We can continue our usual operations undisturbed, and that's certainly something to look forward to. By the by, Strelok's group sent me a prisoner of war. He was asking for you. He's around here somewhere, maybe go speak to him.
True that, but you're the one who's getting paid in the end. We can continue our usual operations undisturbed, and that's certainly something to look forward to.
Has anything new cropped up yet?
Nope. Back to bog-standard contracts. Enjoy the routine.
Hey, Sidorovich. Any special tasks available?

Hm, yes. Not sure if this is what you had in mind, but there's this nutcase hanging around the village. He appeared out of thin air, then started pestering stalkers at campfires about some religious bullshit. Something about the greatness of the Zone. He also wants people to join his organisation, whatever it is. Most stalkers tell him to sod off, but some did accept his offer. I don't want any more rookies to become members of some sort of sect and vanish without a trace, so why don't you take care of this guy?
Should I ask him a few questions first?
Doesn't sound like much of a problem. Maybe I'll check back later.

Yes, try to find out more about his faction. Then we can arrange an accident for him. You know, there's a field of gravitational anomalies not far from here, and hungry mutants roam the area all the time...
I talked to the creep, Sid.
Don't call me like that. So, did you find out anything interesting? Why didn't you put him down?
Don't call me like that. So, did you find out anything interesting before you offed him?

I didn't want to paint a target on the Rookie Village. He's some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He claims that they know more about the Zone than anyone else, and they apparently plan to "cleanse" the world. Like you said, he's here to recruit others to his cause.

He was some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He claimed that they know more about the Zone than anyone else, and they apparently plan to "cleanse" the world. As you said, he was here to recruit others to his cause.

Sin, eh... I actually heard some rumours about such a group throughout the years, though nobody was able to verify them. Come to think of it, there's been a series of skirmishes between many different factions and members of an "unknown" one recently, especially in the Red Forest. Alright, we've got several pieces of puzzle to fit one another. Go to the Red Forest to see what's going on there. Talk to Forester, he should be able to help you. And I'll think how to remove that agent from our premises quietly.

Sin, eh... I actually heard some rumours about such a group throughout the years, though nobody was able to verify them. Come to think of it, there's been a series of skirmishes between many different factions and members of an "unknown" one recently, especially in the Red Forest. Alright, we've got several pieces of puzzle to fit one another. Go to the Red Forest to see what's going on there. Talk to Forester, he should be able to help you. And I'll have someone dump the agent's body into a nearby anomaly field.
Red Forest, yay...
Hey, I'm back. Still alive.
I didn't think a trip to the Red Forest would be enough to take you down. So, did you find out anything?

Bad news as usual. Sin were pursuing Stitch, one of Strelok's companions. I intercepted and destroyed their squad, then contacted the stalker. He said that Sin have been preparing to launch a large scale invasion on the southern sectors of the Zone. He's a reliable person, and everything so far supports his word. Here, take this PDA, it belonged to the squad leader.

Hmm, that sounds bad. Sometimes I scare the rookies with stories about the Monolith, but they're a distant threat. I'm not keen on a bunch of fanatics paying us a visit guns a-blazing. My business would suffer. Anyway, we should do something about this before the situation gets out of hand, so... Oh, what now? One of the rookies has just messaged: a sizeable squad is approaching the Village. They seem to be those Sin fanatics. Why don't you join the others and arrange a welcoming committee for our unexpected guests?
My pleasure.
Well, we killed them all.

That's my boy! Glad to keep you around... however, the stakes have been raised. I've received reports from stalkers across the Zone that Sin's main forces have been moving toward the two psy-installations. I think they want to reactivate them and cut the centre of the Zone off again. Obviously, we can't let that happen.
Sure, I don't feel like disabling them again. But I can only be at one place at a time.

Not a problem. I'll use my contacts to assemble a team to defend one of the installations. I entrust the defence of the other one to you. At any rate, pick one and go quickly, we haven't got much time left.
Miracle Machine. It's a remote location so my help is more needed over there.
Brain Scorcher. We can't let the enemy regain such a formidable stronghold.
I'm back, finally. Sin won't bother us any more, their forces are decimated and their leader's dead.
Excellent work, stalker. Sometimes you remind me of the Marked One, although you actually return from major assignments.
Speaking of Strelok, we couldn't have won without him and his men.

Glad to know he's still somewhere out there, doing his thing. Why don't you stay around, though? People are getting interested in you, and you wouldn't believe how many people will buy the old junk you sell me just because it was once carried by you. Speaking of which, you have a fan waiting for you in the rookie village. Maybe you should go say hello.

Glad to know he's still somewhere out there, doing his thing. Why don't you stay around, though? People are getting interested in you, and you wouldn't believe how many people will buy the old junk you sell me just because it was once carried by you.
That's... nice. No more special tasks for now?
Just the usual stuff for the time being.
Things are looking a little odd around here these days. What's going on?

That creep in a trench coat. He arrived at our base with some other stalkers a few days ago. He didn't cause any trouble at first, so we let him stay. Now he delivers sermons about the greatness of the Zone. That it's some sort of miracle that can help us cleanse the world from sin or whatever. No, I'm not making this up, I heard him personally. He also tried recruiting some of our folks. I can stand a harmless lunatic, but that's some fishy business right there. Go pay him a visit and give him a listen. Try to find out what his goal is. And then... well, many people have been lost to the swamps, those poor souls.
Yeah, I think I've had enough of Zone-worshipping lunatics. I'll go deal with him.
Sorry Cold, I'm not ready to deal with this right now.
Thanks man. He's somewhere around, I guarantee he'll stand out like a sore thumb, so you shouldn't have any trouble noticing him.
I had a little chat with the lunatic.
How was it? And why is he still roaming our base?
How was it? Did he tell you anything useful before his untimely demise?

Because the rabbit hole is deeper than I thought. He's some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He claims that they know more about the Zone than anyone else, that they're its keepers. And like you said earlier, he's looking to recruit others all the while saying a lot of "cleanse the world" type of stuff.

He was some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He claimed that they know more about the Zone than anyone else, that they're its keepers. And like you said earlier, he was looking to recruit others, and said lots of "cleanse the world" type of stuff.

This again... Yeah, I've heard about Sin already, although I used to think they were just a legend. A bunch of scary bastards who appear out of thin air and attack everyone, only to vanish without a trace when they're done. In fact, a few stalkers mentioned that something similar is happening in the Red Forest now. I don't like the way this is shaping up. You should visit the place to discover what's going on. Forester should help you out a bit. Meanwhile, we'll have a little party arranged for our honoured guest.

This again... Yeah, I've heard about Sin already, although I used to think they were just a legend. A bunch of scary bastards who appear out of thin air and attack everyone, only to vanish without a trace when they're done. In fact, a few stalkers mentioned that something similar is happening in the Red Forest now. I don't like the way this is shaping up. You should visit the place to discover what's going on. Forester should help you out a bit. Meanwhile, I'll have someone dump the mortal remains of our honoured guest into the swamp.
Scary bastards in a scary place... sounds like fun.
I've been to the Red Forest, Cold.
How's it been? Have you got any stories to tell?

Just one. Sin were pursuing Stitch, one of Strelok's comrades. The Sin squad I dealt with, and I contacted Stitch afterward. He said that Sin have been preparing to launch a large scale invasion on the southern sectors of the Zone. He's trustworthy, and this PDA I took from the defeated Sin squad should convince you if you aren't already.

Ah, damn. Not the happiest story I've ever heard. I hoped we could settle the Swamps in a more peaceful manner after we had to wash our hands of Renegade blood. I'm getting tired of all the violence, but we can't let a group of omnicidal maniacs just take everything. I suppose there's no avoiding this. Okay then, let's... huh. I've just got a message from the Fishing Hamlet. There's a big enemy squad headed our way. Damn it. Go help them at once, I'll rally our men here.
Okay, I'm going!
We fended off the enemy. We're safe, for now.

It's been a while since we had a sizeable enemy force at our doorstep. Your victory over them is good news. However, I'm afraid I haven't got any good news for you. According to my contacts around the Zone, this assault was merely a side-objective. Sin's true intent lies in reactivating the psy-installations north of us. How about we prepare forces to intercept them there, so we won't have to start from scratch again?
Sounds like a good idea. Which one am I being sent to?

You deactivated both of them before, so I'll leave the choice up to you. You and whoever you bring with you will defend the one you choose. I'll organise a task force to defend the other. I'll trust your judgement, but we haven't got much time to deliberate. Go as soon as you're ready.
I'll defend the Miracle Machine. It's a remote location so my help is more needed over there.
I'll defend the Brain Scorcher. We can't let the enemy regain such a formidable stronghold.
Hey, Cold, I made it. Sin is done for, and so is their leader.
That's great news, stalker! At last, Clear Sky succeeded in its original mission. And we managed to pull through without sacrificing the majority of our men at that. Great job.
And, ironically, Strelok and his crew helped a lot in calming the Zone down again.

Yeah, who would've thought that could happen. Fate really has a twisted sense of humour sometimes. Now that this unholy crusade is over we can return to our boring, low-profile existence. By the way, there's this guy who came here not long ago asking for you. Go pay him a visit, he's somewhere around the base.
Yeah, who would've thought that could happen? Fate really has a twisted sense of humour sometimes. Now that this unholy crusade is over we can return to our boring, low-profile existence.
I have to say, it's good to finally rest a little.
Sure, enjoy yourself for the time being. You deserve it.
Hey Lukash, what's up? Anything interesting going on around here?

Freedom likes all sorts, right? So this guy comes to our base one day, pretty friendly and all. Says he admires the Zone as well. Then he starts pestering our guys about the need to cleanse the whole world from sin. That we don't understand what the Zone truly is, and some other religious crap. In short, he's a little nuts. People are getting a little edgy around here because of him. Can you talk with him? Maybe make some sense out of him? Bonus points if you get him to go away.
Okay. Do you want me to be extra persuasive?
Sorry man, I'm not ready for that sort of thing right now.
I give you a free hand. If he turns out to be dangerous, I trust you'll deal with him appropriately.
Got it.
I talked with the nutter.
He's still around, though? Bummer.
Put him down, too? Good riddance.

He says he's some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He told me much of the things you've already heard, but he also revealed he's looking to recruit others into his group. Seems they've been planning something big.

He was some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He told me much of the things you've already heard, but he also revealed that he was looking to recruit others into his group. Seems they've been planning something big.

Sin? Now that's new. Or is it? A bunch of unidentified stalkers in the Red Forest have been pretending to be Predators and hunt people, apparently. They could well be this "Sin" you've heard about. Hmm, I don't like where this is going. Monolith is bad enough without friends. Why don't you pay Forester a visit and ask him about this mysterious group? And I'll have someone go tell our guest that he's overstayed his welcome.

Sin? Now that's new. Or is it? A bunch of unidentified stalkers in the Red Forest have been pretending to be Predators and hunt people, apparently. They could well be this "Sin" you've heard about. Hmm, I don't like where this is going. Monolith is bad enough without friends. Why don't you pay Forester a visit and ask him about this mysterious group? And I'll have someone clean up the stiff you left lying around.
Alrighty, time for a new adventure.
I'm back from the Red Forest picnic, boss.
Oh, hey man. How was the trip? Met any interesting people over there?

A few of them. Reunited with Stitch, who was being chased by Sin. You were right about them. Anyway, the hunting squad is dead, but Stitch said that Sin've been preparing to launch a large scale invasion on the southern sectors of the Zone. He's trustworthy, and it seems that way anyway. Take a look at this: the head Predator's PDA.

Man, we've got a major war on the horizon. Well, I was fed up with the constant Monolith attacks anyway. This'll be a nice change of pace. I'll rally our guys for another faction war, just give me... a sec... Hmm. Guards at the main gate just reported that a large squad's approaching our base. Shots fired... but they aren't Monolith! Crap. Go help them out, will ya? I'll try to organise something here.
Sure, I'm going!
Guess who's just wasted a bunch of fanatics?

I'm betting all of my roubles on you. Anyhow, you did a great job, but that's not the end. Our guys say that the enemy forces are approaching the two psy-installations right about now. Pretty sure they want them active again. I prefer the Zone being open to everyone, so let's keep it that way, shall we?
Heck yeah, but I doubt I can defend both of them at the same time unless you give me a really good sniper rifle.

Ah, that won't be necessary. I can send a team to protect one of the installations, so you won't hog all the glory this time. Still, pick the one you want to defend personally. And better hurry, it's rude to be late for a party.
Miracle Machine. It's a remote location so my help is more needed over there.
Brain Scorcher. It's close and quite important.
Here I am, the destroyer of Sin. Even gave their leader a proper burial in the Sarcophagus and all.
Wow, now that's a job well done! You're on fire, man. Let's keep our Zone the way we love it: unpredictable and deadly, but cosy. No need to change a thing about it.
I tend to agree and, oddly enough, Strelok and his friends helped me a lot to keep it that way.

Yeah, the guy's got balls of steel, but it's even better that he no longer wants to destroy the Zone. I hope. Anyhow, now that you're here you should check out a recent newcomer, he's been asking for you. Probably wandering around the base right now.
Yeah, the guy's got balls of steel, but it's even better that he no longer wants to destroy the Zone. I hope.
You won't mind if I chill out for a while? I'm a bit tired here.
Rest all you want mate, but don't forget to come to the victory celebration party!
Everything fine in here, Professor? The guards seem on edge, more than usual.

Sometimes I cannot tell if you are joking, young man. I suppose the situation is fairly stable, at least. Come to think of it, there has been one unsettling development here lately. Some new stalkers came to Yantar a few days ago, this hooded fellow among them. Rather than help our guards fend off the constant incursions he prefers to preach about the wonders of the Zone. I heard him myself, and I am afraid the man might be insane. He has done no direct harm to us so far, although our guards are growing weary of his presence. Please, try to convince him to leave us be.
Preaching about the Zone? Sounds eerily familiar. I'll question him first and then I'll see what I can do.
I apologise Professor, I'm not ready to deal with more fanatics right now.
I am very grateful.
I completed my task, Professor.
Very well. What did you discover?
So, you killed him. A drastic solution...

He's some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He claims that they know more about the Zone than anyone else, and they apparently plan to "cleanse" the world. Also, he looks for recruits to join their cause.

I'm afraid we couldn't let him stay here any longer. He was some sort of agent from a faction called Sin. He claimed that they know more about the Zone than anyone else, and they apparently plan to "cleanse" the world. Also, he looked for recruits to join their cause.

That is disturbing. My guards have recently been encountering hostile stalkers from a mysterious faction. He is likely a member of that very faction. As far as I know, they frequent the Red Forest for their hunting. However, a legendary man lives there, called Forester. Please, talk to him about the situation. The more we know, the better we can prepare for whatever will come. Meanwhile, I'll talk with the guards about this security breach.

That is disturbing. My guards have recently been encountering hostile stalkers from a mysterious faction. He was likely a member of that very faction. As far as I know, they frequent the Red Forest for their hunting. However, a legendary man lives there, called Forester. Please, talk to him about the situation. The more we know, the better we can prepare for whatever will come. Meanwhile, I'll have the guards dispose of the agent's body.
I'll see what I can do.
I investigated the situation in the Red Forest, Professor.
Very well. I hope you discovered something of value.

Sin were pursuing a comrade of Strelok whom I met during my previous mission. I intercepted and destroyed their squad, then contacted the stalker. He said that Sin have been preparing to launch a large scale invasion on the southern sectors of the Zone. He's a reliable person, and everything so far seems to support his claim. Please take the PDA I took from the squad leader's body.

Oh my...! This is indeed grim news. The Monolith are at least contained in their current territory for the most part. I am afraid we have to deal with an equally formidable yet much more encroaching enemy now. We ought to... oh no. Seems we are under attack! Our guards spotted a hostile force approaching the mobile bunker. Please, go help them repel the enemy!
I'm on it!
The area is clear, we've defeated the enemy.

Excellent work, young man! I knew I could count on you. Sadly, this is merely the beginning. Military gunships observed substantial Sin forces moving toward both of the psy-installations. Given our current knowledge it is safe to assume they intend to reactivate them. The best course of action is to thwart their plan right now.
I agree, Professor. But we simply haven't got the personnel to do this. How will we defend both places adequately at once?

I will speak with Colonel Kuznetsov. While he'll surely be fortifying the Zone's borders to ensure Sin doesn't break out, I'm certain that he can still organise a force suitable enough to protect at least one of the installations. You will have to organise the defence of the other one, however, and fast, because our enemy does not seem to be willing to wait much longer. Please, hurry!
I'll defend the Miracle Machine. It's right next to us so it's the most immediate threat.
I'll defend the Brain Scorcher. We can't let the enemy regain such a formidable stronghold.
We've succeeded, Professor. The Sin forces have been routed, and their leader is dead.

What a horrible conflict, I am glad it is over. You have done well, young man. I knew I could count on you in this time of need. I sincerely hope that the Zone will be able to reach a state of equilibrium at last.
Victory wouldn't have been possible were it not for Strelok and his friends.

The Marked One, or rather Strelok, continues to live up to his legendary status. I can be at peace knowing that for every dangerous fanatic out there, we have got a resourceful and reasonable stalker to help maintain the shaky balance. In fact, we might have another such stalker amongst us. Last I saw, he was wandering around outside the bunker. You should go say hello to him.

The Marked One, or rather Strelok, continues to live up to his legendary status. I can be at peace knowing that for every dangerous fanatic out there, we have got a resourceful and reasonable stalker to help maintain the shaky balance.
Is that all, Professor?
Yes, you are free to return to your usual activities now.
Greetings, stalker. Do you seek enlightenment?
Greetings, mercenary. Do you seek enlightenment?
Hi.
What do you need?
I want to talk.
I've got a couple of questions, you creepy bastard.
Good. I'm glad that among all the people who single-mindedly pursue personal gain there are still some willing to talk about something greater. What do you want to know?

Be careful not to judge too quickly. Rumours and impressions can be deceiving. All I want is to share my knowledge with you and your friends. Ask, and I'll answer. You might find this very beneficial.
Who are you?

I am but a humble envoy of our Father. Long ago I used to be like any other stalker. But then I was shown the truth about the Zone. That was when I changed, became an entirely different person. My identity doesn't matter any more. All that matters is my message.
Who sent you?

The community to which I belong. We call ourselves Sin, after the flaw in humanity that we wish to correct. Various factions have various goals. Some wish to destroy the Zone, some to exploit its riches, and others marvel at its many wonders. However, we alone know the truth. We are the true keepers of the Zone. We alone boast all the knowledge and power that the Zone may grant.
Sin? I don't think I've ever heard of you before.
I heard some stories about "dark stalkers", but nothing concrete.

For as long as the Zone has existed, we have kept a low profile. Rather than engage in turf wars or scour the Zone in pursuit of riches, we prefer to silently collect knowledge. Grow stronger. Where two are fighting, the third one wins. But now, we are almost ready to step out of the shadows... and into the light of Vyraj. I hope you'll step into it with us.
What's your goal?

My goal is to spread the message. Make all people aware of what the Zone truly is. That it is a miracle. That it can help us improve, that it can save humanity from its own self-destructive nature. I strive to encourage other stalkers to join us, so we may share the power inherent in the Zone's many secrets. This way, when push comes to shove, they'll be able to stand with us when we cleanse the world of sin.
That sounds fairly interesting.
I'm not buying this crap.
I knew you'd be interested. You have turned out to be quite special. Sadly, not everyone is ready to join our ranks, but I've got high hopes about you.
That's alright, you might need a while to consider what I've said. I remember how difficult it was to let go of my own old views. Please, take your time.
Thank you for bringing forth your... enlightenment. I must go now.
Enough of this nonsense. Time to end you.
Very well. I hope you'll consider joining us. Farewell.
Fool. Sin has no end. There shall only be yours.
Please, just shut up and die.
Forester, I'm looking for some mysterious stalkers who've been, well, stalking this forest. Could you help?
Young man, the Red Forest is home to many strange phenomena and events. If I were to describe all of them, we would...
So you don't know?

Just be patient young man, I'm trying to remember! Ah, yes... I think I know who you're referring to. They appeared without warning a couple of days ago. Came from the north. There was something ominous about them, the way they walked silently in a tight formation... other stalkers immediately sidestepped to make way for them. And then they simply walked into the forest like it was some regular park. I've heard distant gunshots many times since, more often than usual, that is.
They're still over there?

Yes, I'm quite sure of that. I think they've been looking for something, or someone, what exactly I can't tell. Judging by the smoke, however, they have set up camp in the eastern part of the Red Forest and continue their search.
Eastern part, you say?

There is a glade over there, accessed through an abandoned mine shaft. If you wish to confront them then that's where they are likely to be. Aside from my tower, the Limansk bridge, and the mines to the west, there's no other place around here that could shelter a party of that size.
Thanks for the info. I'll be going now.
Be careful, young man. There's more than hostile stalkers that you may encounter there. Stay vigilant.
That's an unexpected reunion. What are you doing here?
Hey man, long time no see! It's a long, complicated story but I'll try to be concise. We're short on time here, I've been followed by a bunch of mean guys.
They're dead. I took care of them before they could come pay you a visit.

Oh... thanks a lot, man! Anyway, the faster we act, the better. So, remember the Shard of the Monolith? That artefact you helped Strelok get? Well, he asked it about the Zone and it granted him a vision or something. Like some magic 8 ball, only actually magic. Anyway, we discovered an area north-west of the Power Plant. A real scary place.
What did you do next?

Well, we went to take a proper look around and that was when shit hit the fan. Turned out there's a band of fanatics there... but they weren't Monolith! Fuckers chased us off and kept pursuing us for days. We eventually had to split up to lose them. I went here, Rogue went west, and I think Strelok actually turned back.
And those same fanatics chased you all the way to the Red Forest? That's some scary resolve.

Too bad for them you crossed their path. Before we split up, Strelok said that place we found is the source of all emissions, the birthplace of the Zone. And it's occupied by those nutcases. That can't be good.
Holy crap! I agree. Have you got any plan?

We have to break in and stop whatever they're doing over there. But, uhm, I left my decoder in a secret stash. I wanted to retrieve it, but I was afraid they'd find me the second I stuck my head out of here.
That's not a problem any more, so what's stopping you?

Erm, they will send another team if they haven't already, and they know what I look like. But they don't know you 'cause you killed the whole team. That, and I need to stay here in case Strelok or Rogue will try to contact me. Can you get the decoder for me?
Yeah, sure, another fetch quest. Where is it?
I hid it at the back of an orange bus wreckage near the middle of the Truck Cemetery.
Which one? Forget it, just send me the coordinates.
Thing is, you see, I haven't got the coordinates stored anywhere. It's a secret stash, after all. I'm sure you'll be able to find it, though.
Are you crazy? There's like dozens of buses in there...

Well... The decoder has an RF module to transmit and receive signals. I set the frequency to 171 MHz just in case I missed its location. If you have an RF Receiver, you can try following its signal by using this frequency. Once you get close enough to its location, your device should start beeping. It should be easy enough to find it. I hope the batteries inside the decoder are still alive...
Eh, all right, I'll do it but this better be worth the effort.
We might stop a bunch of fanatics from haphazardly unleashing emission after emission on us if you get it.
Fair enough. Off I go.
I've got your damn decoder, Stitch.
I knew you'd get it no problem, man. Which is disturbing, actually. Still, thanks.
Any news?

Yup. I was able to contact Rogue. He's still somewhere to the west, observing enemy manoeuvres. He said Sin has mobilised a lot of men and are currently moving southward split into several detachments. That doesn't augur well for us.

True, that can't be good. Come to think of it, their envoy said something about cleansing the whole world from sin. They might be about to attempt just that. We'll have to act fast if we want to stop them.
Now that I've got the decoder I'll go back north. I must find Strelok and help him sabotage their base.
You do that and I'll tell General Voronin about the situation. Let's go!
You do that and I'll tell Dushman about the situation. Let's go!
You do that and I'll tell Sidorovich about the situation. Let's go!
You do that and I'll tell Cold about the situation. Let's go!
You do that and I'll tell Lukash about the situation. Let's go!
You do that and I'll tell Professor Sakharov about the situation. Let's go!
You're here! Great!
So, you got here before us. Where's Strelok?

That's the thing! He said we couldn't wait any longer, so we found a back entrance to the enemy base here, undefended and all. After we'd hacked the lift Strelok went alone to disable their thingamajig. I'm here to cover him.
Damn it, you could've waited a bit...

You hear that? We have to hurry! But, but, we saw Sin gathering their forces near the main entrance. If they notice Strelok and all go down to stop him then we can kiss our asses goodbye! We have to divert their attention away!
Okay, fuck! We'll assault their headquarters. Let's go!
We made it. Another mutant fanatic bites the dust. Hopefully, that'll be the last one.
Agreed. I mean I like it here in the Zone, but the idea that there's normal life going on out there helps me relax now and then. I'd love a safe place to return to when I'm done adventuring.
Yeah, the Zone doesn't really need to get any larger.
I suppose we're done here. Rogue and I will rejoin with Strelok. What about you? Do you want to make a wish?
Make a wish? I'd never use that abomination for personal gain, or at all. I'll report our success to General Voronin. Thanks for the help, Duty will remember your contribution.
Nah, I'd prefer something more reliable, like cash. This whole Wish Granter business is rather iffy. I'll tell Dushman we kicked Sin's asses. See you around, guys.
Many rookies come to the Zone to eventually find the Wish Granter... but I'm not a naive rookie. I can earn money just fine. I'll go tell Sidorovich about our success, so see you around.

From what I know the Wish Granter has got a dark sense of humour. I'd rather not risk reliving "The Monkey's Paw". I'll be happy to tell Cold that Clear Sky succeeded this time, though. Thanks for the help guys, see you!

Nope, I think I'm good. Life in the Zone is cool as is, I don't need no happy ending just yet. What even would I wish for? I'll tell Lukash and guys plenty of stories about our little adventure. Thanks, guys, and see ya!

I'd love to examine the so-called Wish Granter... but I think the risk is too great. It's a product of scientists being reckless. Maybe I'll break that trend, and just report to the Professor as soon as possible. I appreciate your help, guys. Farewell.
Well, since I've gone through all this trouble to save the world, I suppose I deserve the ultimate reward.
Oh, okay, if you say so. We'll accompany you to see the result, just in case.
Hey, tough guy.
Hey, Rogue. Can you repair my stuff?
What's the situation here, Rogue?

Not good. When you stopped Sin from reactivating the psy-installations, they decided to retreat and regroup in Limansk. I managed to recruit a few stalkers, but it's simply not enough, especially since Sin have allied with the Monolith already present in the city. I saw them fighting shoulder to shoulder myself.
That's just great. I was worried that those brainwashed cults were starting to get a little lonely.

Very funny. Sin now seem to organise themselves into large groups, each led by a powerful exo-clad warrior known as a "Castigator". They're not only amazing fighters, but decent tacticians. I barely managed to kill even one, and they've been consistently pushing us back.
Great. So, what's the plan?
Our counter-offence will be executed in a few stages. First, we have to get rid of their leadership. That'll slow them down significantly.
Sounds rather difficult.

It sure will be. By the way, General Voronin sent a team of volunteers to help you out. They're all seasoned stalkers with deep vendettas against the Zone and its worshippers. Go and decapitate the enemy.
It sure will be. By the way, Dushman sent a team of volunteers to help you out. They're all seasoned mercs with impeccable reputations for professionalism. Go and decapitate the enemy.
It sure will be. By the way, I've assembled a team of volunteers to help you out. They're all seasoned stalkers, some of whom I trained myself. Go and decapitate the enemy.
It sure will be. By the way, Cold sent a team of volunteers to help you out. They're all seasoned stalkers, some of them veterans of the faction wars. Go and decapitate the enemy.
It sure will be. By the way, Lukash sent a team of volunteers to help you out. They're all seasoned stalkers who don't want madmen like this try to control the Zone. Go and decapitate the enemy.

It sure will be. By the way, Professor Sakharov sent a team of volunteers to help you out. They're all seasoned stalkers, although I hope they've dressed for the occasion. Go and decapitate the enemy.
It was rough, but the Castigators are dead.
Good job. Finally, we've got some breathing room. Your boss sent a reward for your efforts, so I'll pass it to you.
Thanks. What now?

A few stalkers and I managed to ambush a Sin patrol in the meantime. Killed most of them immediately, but I knocked one of them out. Seems to be a relatively fresh recruit, so he's a bit more responsive. I'm no good at interrogation, I get violent too quickly. Try to extract any useful info from him.
Sure thing, I'll give this a try.
Okay, I'm done.
Well done. I didn't expect him to spill the beans without a good beating. Seems they aren't ready to strike yet. We should prepare a sudden counter-offence to thwart their plan.
Just as I thought. No problem. I suppose my more persuasive approach might do the trick.
What a waste of time. I doubt we'll be able to capture any more of them. We'll have to figure this out on our own, then.
So, what happens now?

I sent out a recon team soon after you'd gone to eliminate the Castigators. They were supposed to use the opportunity to observe enemy manoeuvres deep in the city. They'd been doing well until they got ambushed and I lost contact with them. Check if there are any survivors, and see if you can salvage their mission.
Where were they the last time you contacted them?
I'll upload the coordinates to your PDA. Be careful, it's close to a fortified enemy position.
I'm back. I met the last survivor of the recon team. He didn't last long.
Fuck. They were reliable men. What about their mission?
The survivor wasn't able to tell me much, but I found the team leader's PDA. I think he recorded some useful data on it.
Good, at least their sacrifice wasn't in vain. Let me see.
So?

They did a swell job. Their observations confirm what the PoW told us. Sin are preparing a large scale invasion, and they're gonna pass through Limansk at full strength soon. They aren't ready yet, though.
They did a swell job. Guess we didn't need the PoW after all. Sin are preparing a large scale invasion, and they're gonna pass through Limansk at full strength soon. They aren't ready yet, though.
We have to act quickly, catch them unawares.
You're right. Still, this won't be easy. Make sure you're completely ready before we go, there'll be no turning back or stopping for a break.
Fair enough, I'll tell you when I've finished my preparations.
I'm ready to go.
About time. We'll strike at their outpost at the abandoned construction site first. That'll open the path further into their territory.
You said it was fortified?

They've got a barricade with a narrow entrance, clear view of the surrounding area from high ground and a bunch of snipers for good measure. Ah, and the whole place is heavily irradiated. Piece of cake. Let's go.
This is going to be fun...
Well, we're still alive.
We've just taken over their main rally point while their reinforcements are still in transit. We should keep the momentum going.
We're going further north?
Yes. There's a path that'll take us to the Deserted Hospital. It used to be a Monolith stronghold a few years ago, so things might get ugly if we let them get too comfortable there.
Sounds like time is of the essence. Let's go.
Damn. He simply vanished. Are you okay?
Of all the things in the Zone... Yes, I'm fine. He wanted me to shoot you in the back.
Well, thanks for not doing that. How did you resist him? I just barely managed here.

I visualised disassembling, cleaning and assembling my gun, bit by bit... anyway, we have to go. The guy said he wants to expand the Zone, and they happen to occupy the place that causes emissions. Basically, we're fucked.
Yeah. We've got to hurry. We'll take out any Sin patrols along the way too. Last thing I want is to be surrounded by armed fanatics while Chernobog is playing his mind tricks on us.
You can break me but you can't break Sin! We will emerge victorious!
Hello there.
Duty! You think you've got the right to destroy the Zone? You think that's even possible!? Fools!
Mercenaries! Stop interfering with something you don't understand! Get your blood money elsewhere!
Stalkers! Always the same greedy, self-righteous children! Leave now, or perish!
Hah! Clear Sky! We know your secrets... but you don't know ours! We'll spread the Zone across the whole world and you can't stop us!
A Freedomer? You understand the miracle that is the Zone, but the magnitude of your sins is unacceptable. You'll die like the rest!
Silly scientists... why fight us at all? If you want to research the Zone then just you wait! We'll make it all the greater for you to study!
Calm down, man. I just want to talk a little.
I've got a couple of questions.
Shut the fuck up, you bloody fanatic.
You... okay. You wanna talk, huh? About what?
Questions? Why would I answer any questions from a filthy profligate... unless you seek enlightenment?
You cannot silence the voice of the Zone!
You put up a good fight, but you're clearly a newbie. Don't let those edgy Sin freaks control you. Tell me the next step of their plan, and we'll let you live.
Reveal the next step of your plan. We might strike a deal if you cooperate.
Listen, you mindless piece of shit. Tell me what your forces are gonna do and we'll make this quick. If you don't, I'll be sure to cut slowly...
Sin doesn't control me! They... convinced me! What's the point of struggling alone to achieve anything if you can join them... and make the world better! I... think...
Cooperate? How about no? I won't be making any deals with infidels like you.
I'm not afraid of you! We must all be ready to make the ultimate sacrifice for the sake of this planet! I... I am ready!
I don't think you've bought their bullshit yet. Don't trust a bunch of omnicidal bastards. Your life's worth more than a piece of info. Sin may be willing to toss it aside, but I'm not.
You definitely should consider my offer in your current position.
I'm fed up with you. Time to die.
I... my head... Chernobog... our Father... he was very convincing... but the more I think about this, the less convinced I am. Promise you won't kill me if I tell you what I know, alright?
Consider? You should be the one to consider your situation! You stand in the way of progress! Of something greater than you! You should be the one to surrender!
I promise. You'll be a prisoner of war. Behave and you may even be released once we've won this conflict.
Let's just get this over with.

Okay. Fine. I'll tell you. We've been gathering our forces in the west of the Zone in preparation for a crushing offence. This area is worse protected than the Barrier, after all. Then, we would pour into the southern territories and pick off the factions one by one.
I'm not telling you! I will not compromise the mission! I will not betray the integrity of our cause!
See, that wasn't so hard. Thanks for the help. Hope your head feels better soon.
Well, that was pointless.
What's up, bro?
So, you're the guy that Rogue captured in Limansk. What was your name?
Yeah, my name... I don't remember my real name, but Sin called me Psoglav, so I guess I'll keep using that.
You don't remember? Anyway, why did you join Duty?
You don't remember? Anyway, why did you become a merc?
You don't remember? I see you've chosen to be an unaligned stalker now.
You don't remember? Anyway, why did you join Clear Sky?
You don't remember? Anyway, why did you join Freedom?
You don't remember? Anyway, why did you join the Ecologists?

You helped me shake off Chernobog's brainwashing, but my memory is still very hazy. Rogue let me go and since you'd been kind to me, I decided to return the gesture and join Duty. I can help you out if you like, can't remember if I was a mechanic or not but I still know how to fix stuff. Heh.

You helped me shake off Chernobog's brainwashing, but my memory is still very hazy. Rogue let me go and since you'd been kind to me, I decided to try meet up again as a merc. I can help you out if you like, can't remember if I was a mechanic or not but I still know how to fix stuff. Heh.

Yeah. You helped me shake off Chernobog's brainwashing, but my memory is still very hazy. Rogue let me go and since you'd been kind to me, I decided to live on as a regular stalker. I can help you out if you like, can't remember if I was a mechanic or not but I still know how to fix stuff. Heh.

You helped me shake off Chernobog's brainwashing, but my memory is still very hazy. Rogue let me go and since you'd been kind to me, I decided to return the gesture and join Clear Sky. I can help you out if you like, can't remember if I was a mechanic or not but I still know how to fix stuff. Heh.

You helped me shake off Chernobog's brainwashing, but my memory is still very hazy. Rogue let me go and since you'd been kind to me, I decided to live on as part of Freedom. I can help you out if you like, can't remember if I was a mechanic or not but I still know how to fix stuff. Heh.

You helped me shake off Chernobog's brainwashing, but my memory is still very hazy. Rogue let me go and since you'd been kind to me, I decided to join the Ecologists. I can help you out if you like, can't remember if I was a mechanic or not but I still know how to fix stuff. Heh.
I'll think about that. Wait, did you come all the way here all alone with just a pistol?
I managed somehow. Back when I was recruited by Sin they did some... stuff to me so I guess I'm enhanced a little. You know, silver lining.
Not bad. I'll keep your offer in mind.
Hey man, can you fix my gear?
Ah... shit...
Are you from the scout team? What happened?
Yes... bloodsuckers got us... quick... find... dropped PDA... nearby...
Wait, let me help you.
Too late... find PDA... watch... out...
Understood.
I have been waiting for you.
You have come a long way.
A welcoming committee, how nice. Good thing I didn't shoot you on sight, mister...?
Identify yourself at once.
Who the fuck are you?
My flock have taken to calling me "Chernobog". I saw the distant glow of Vyraj and I swear... I shall bring that light to this violent world.

Consider the Zone: a synthesis of the noosphere and the biosphere. Consider how destructive, how... hungry... the noosphere is. That's simply a reflection of human nature. But the Zone... the Zone could well be the remedy to our derailment. If it were to spread across the globe, everyone could see themselves for what they truly are. No more deceptions, nor delusions. Then, the healing could begin. I need you to stop killing my children. I need you to let them bring peace to this restless world.
Sorry for throwing a spanner in the works, I suppose, but your merry men started killing us first.
The C-Consciousness already tried to heal humanity, using similarly extreme methods. Instead, they unleashed a disaster.
"Peace"? Enforced with guns, anomalies and abominations? Sorry, but I don't give a shit about some false prophet's insane vision.

I don't expect you to understand this grand vision... this task I have been given, despite your extensive knowledge of the Zone. I used to exact punishment upon the unjust on my own, although my efforts were misunderstood. I was condemned to death... but the Masters saved me from the people who didn't understand, and then made me stronger. Gave me a new purpose. And yet they were sentenced to death themselves, helpless, by a person who didn't understand. Don't you see? Stalkers are a threat to the coming of a perfect world. Fear or greed always gets the better of them. We cannot let them interfere.
You're surprisingly calm for someone who's about to suffer a crushing defeat. Have you accepted your fate already?
I accepted my fate over a decade ago, when it was first mandated by the Masters. I was improved in order to improve the world. My destiny is to... succeed. I cannot fail. You, on the other hand...
Okay, time to end this.
... shall stop right here.
Ugh... what... is this...?!?
That pathetic psy-helmet you carry won't protect you. Either you'll come to see the truth in my words, or you will die here... all of you.
I won't... let you...!
Struggle all you want, like the billions of souls who have come before you. There will be change... the stubborn... the dying... it is not up to them any more. It is not up to you.
Screw your... change... and fuck you!
I can't let this... happen... I... can't...
Ugh... my head... aaaargh!
Hmm. Impressive. Such a strong resolve. I truly wish you'd join us. The fact we are enemies saddens me... deeply.
I'll put you out of your misery soon enough, just you wait. I swear.
Here you are, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing. There'll be no place for you... in our peaceful world.
Your men are dead. You are here alone. Strelok has foiled your plan, just as he foiled the C-Consciousness before you.
What did you say?
The machines you wanted to harness the emission with? They're broken. You cannot force the Zone to expand now.
Years of preparation... gone. My children, dead. I cannot let their sacrifice be in vain. I won't... let you doom the world. I shan't give up. The alternative... is unacceptable.
Enough is enough. You have failed. Prepare to say goodbye.
I cannot fail. There is still one option left. I will consult the Wish Granter. It shall have my life, and the world will have peace... Vyraj made manifest, just as the Masters wanted. Farewell.
You can't force peace, Chernobog. I'll be seeing you soon.
